intro: Synaptantha tillaeacea var. hispidula, commonly known as the hairy synaptantha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a unique texture. It produces showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. This variant is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
